Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <PTYX11> The change was introduced upstream. There should have been a lock on the dependency so it couldn't be updated remotely. This could have happened to anyone. The key thing here is that this sort of event makes or breaks a project. At the end of the day, consumers didn't lose funds. Komodo took the hit and returned funds to everyone that claimed. Komodo didn't break which also shows the teams actions were swift and true.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <PTYX11> If anything, this should bolster your trust in the team and their resolve to securing your funds.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <loxal> btw the around ~23786 NPM dependencies that an avarage JavaScript project and pulls GB-wise non-checked JavaScript code into your JS build... apps that are build this way, are not necessarily suitable for high confidentiality apps

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <loxal> a common practice in many JS projects like Agama is to tell the dependency management system to pull "the latest version" of an dependency which is also just in same in terms of build & quality reliability

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
there are no z-addresses on the KMD blockchain now
we have deprecated that feature
I am not sure what the z-send in the qt-wallet does now
you can use send

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Z transactions may be available for KMD in the future in the form of a parallel chain
